biospec_descr.textblock: pregnant over 35 weeks. medically free.single intrauterine pregnancy

brief_summary.textblock:
Good glycemic control is superior to poor glycemic control in reducing risk of
      interventricular septal thickness among fetuses of diabetic mothers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interventricular Cardiac Septal Thickness in Fetus of Diabetic Mother Correlated to Postnatal Outcome
clinical_study.condition: Maternal Diabetes Mellites Effect on Fetus

detailed_description.textblock:
Thick Interventricular septum is thought to be related to poor glycemic control during
      pregnancy, and it causes variable degree of left ventricular outflow obstruction and
      hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

      Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy requires specific management as digoxin and inotropic agents
      usually used in heart failure are contraindicated.

      So high index of suspicion is required in fetus of diabetic mother having thick   Inter
      ventricular septum.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  above 35 weeks pregnancy

          -  diabetic mothers

          -  single intrauterine pregnancy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any other medical disorder

clinical_study.official_title: Interventricular Cardiac Septal Thickness in Fetus of Diabetic Mother Correlated to Postnatal Outcome

oversight_info.authority: Egypt: Ministry of Health and Population

primary_outcome.measure: To study interventricular septal thickness in fetus of diabetic mother and correlate it with good glycemic control.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
